title: Knight's Tournament Grounds Adventure #71
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Grand Tournament Pavilion
rooms.description: A magnificent pavilion with colorful banners hanging from wooden beams. Shields bearing noble crests line the walls. The smell of leather and oil fills the air. Wooden benches surround a central display of tournament trophies. Through the entrance, you can hear the distant echo of cheering crowds from past tournaments.

items.name: trophy display case
items.description: A glass case containing silver cups and golden laurels from past tournaments

items.name: tournament program scroll
items.description: A parchment listing the events and history of the tournament grounds
items.text: Grand Tournament of 1347 - Founded by Lord Blackstone. Events: Jousting, Melee Combat, Archery. Champion: Sir Roland the Brave. Herald: Master Edmund. Remember: the combination to the storage chest is the founding year.

items.name: wall of heraldic banners
items.description: Colorful banners displaying the coats of arms of noble houses
items.text: The banners represent the great houses: House Blackstone (black tower on silver), House Redmane (red lion), House Goldenshield (golden sun). Lord Blackstone's banner hangs highest as founder of these grounds.

items.name: carved wooden bench
items.description: A sturdy bench with tournament scenes carved into the wood

items.name: small brass key
items.description: A key with a shield emblem engraved on the handle

items.name: tournament storage chest
items.description: A heavy wooden chest with iron bands and a four-digit combination lock

items.name: ornate silver key
items.description: A decorative key with tournament symbols etched along its length

items.name: herald's journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal belonging to Master Edmund
items.text: Master Edmund's Records: As herald, I announce all champions and maintain the rolls of honor. Sir Roland won the grand championship in the jousting arena. The armory holds the weapons and armor of past champions. Only those who know the tournament's history may enter the champion's hall.

items.name: equipment cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with brass fittings and a keyhole

items.name: tournament rules parchment
items.description: An official document outlining the rules and traditions
items.text: Official Tournament Rules: All contests held in the jousting arena. Lord Blackstone presides as judge. Master Edmund serves as herald. Champions receive glory and honor. The armory door requires the silver key for access.

items.name: pavilion door to armory
items.description: A reinforced wooden door with metal studs, leading to the armory where weapons and armor are stored

rooms.name: Knights' Armory
rooms.description: A spacious armory filled with suits of armor standing like silent sentinels. Weapon racks display swords, lances, and maces. The walls are decorated with shields bearing the marks of famous champions. A large table holds maintenance tools and oil for the equipment. The champion's hall entrance stands at the far end.

items.name: row of armor stands
items.description: Five complete suits of plate armor, each belonging to a past champion
items.text: Plaques identify each suit: Sir Roland the Brave, Sir Marcus the Strong, Lady Catherine the Swift, Sir William the Just, Sir Geoffrey the Bold. Sir Roland's armor bears the most honors.

items.name: tournament weapon rack
items.description: A rack holding various tournament weapons, all blunted for safety

items.name: champion's lance
items.description: A ceremonial lance with Sir Roland's crest painted on the shaft

items.name: maintenance table
items.description: A workbench covered with tools, oil, and leather straps

items.name: armorer's note
items.description: A note left by the armory keeper
items.text: Reminder: Sir Roland's armor needs polishing before the ceremony. The champion's hall can only be entered by those who understand our traditions. Lord Blackstone will preside, Master Edmund will announce, and the contests are held in the jousting arena.

items.name: wall of champion shields
items.description: Shields mounted on the wall, each painted with unique heraldry
items.text: Each shield tells a story of valor. Sir Roland's shield shows a white eagle on blue, symbolizing his victory in the jousting arena. The inscription reads: 'Champion of the Grand Tournament, victor of the joust.'

items.name: glass trophy case
items.description: A locked case displaying the most prestigious tournament prizes

items.name: golden champion medallion
items.description: A heavy gold medallion engraved with tournament symbols

items.name: tournament record book
items.description: A large tome recording all tournament results and champions
items.text: Tournament Records: Year 1347 - Grand Champion: Sir Roland the Brave, Event: Jousting. Herald: Master Edmund. Presiding Judge: Lord Blackstone, Founder. Location: Jousting Arena. All champions are honored in the champion's hall.

items.name: entrance to champion's hall
items.description: An impressive doorway carved with scenes of tournament glory. Three questions are inscribed on a bronze plaque beside the entrance.

password_questions.question: Who founded the tournament grounds?
password_questions.hint: Check the tournament program and the record book for the founder's name

password_questions.question: Where are the contests held?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention the location of tournament events

password_questions.question: Who was the grand champion?
password_questions.hint: Look at the armor stands, shields, and tournament records

rooms.name: Champion's Hall of Glory
rooms.description: You have entered the legendary Champion's Hall! A magnificent chamber with vaulted ceilings and stained glass windows depicting famous tournament victories. Golden plaques line the walls, each bearing the name of a champion. At the center, a raised platform holds the Champion's Throne. Sunlight streams through the windows, illuminating a grand archway that leads to freedom.

items.name: champion's throne
items.description: An ornate throne carved from oak and decorated with gold leaf, where champions are honored

items.name: stained glass windows
items.description: Beautiful windows showing knights in glorious combat
items.text: The windows depict the greatest moments in tournament history: Sir Roland's legendary joust, Lady Catherine's archery triumph, and Lord Blackstone presenting the first championship trophy.

items.name: wall of golden plaques
items.description: Dozens of plaques commemorating tournament champions through the ages
items.text: Each plaque honors a champion. The largest and most prominent reads: 'Sir Roland the Brave - Grand Champion of 1347 - Victor of the Joust - His courage and skill shall be remembered forever.'

items.name: ceremonial table
items.description: A table holding the championship regalia and ceremonial items

items.name: champion's victory crown
items.description: A golden laurel crown awarded to the grand champion

rooms.win_message: You have reached the Champion's Hall and proven yourself worthy! As you stand in this hallowed space where legends are made, you feel the weight of history and honor. The grand archway opens before you, leading to the tournament grounds exit and your freedom. You have conquered the challenges of the Knight's Tournament Grounds! You win!
